title: About
text:
🎉 Welcome to Geochronicles of Steppe and Tundra! 🎉
Hi there! I’m Evgeny Noi, and you’ve just stumbled upon a corner of the web where geography, data, and a bit of adventure come together. 🌍📊
In this blog, I dive into the fascinating world of spatial and spatio-temporal data, exploring everything from the hidden patterns in maps to the latest methods in geospatial analysis. Whether you’re a seasoned data enthusiast or just curious, grab a seat (or a kettlebell 💪), and let’s uncover the mysteries of the earth together!
Currently, I’m at the Institute of Behavioral Science at CU Boulder 🏔️, where I develop cutting-edge nation-wide and global population forecasting models. Before moving to Colorado, I earned my Ph.D. from the Geography Department at UC Santa Barbara 🌊.
When I’m not crunching numbers, you’ll find me playing guitar 🎸, swinging kettlebells, or exploring the breathtaking trails of the Rocky Mountains. 🏞️
